intro: Homalobus stenophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf homalobus, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many genera with showy flowers and medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
